basics.name: Jeff Eaton
basics.label: Digital Publishing Obsessive
basics.summary: I combine content strategy and technical architecture experience with a deep love of the publishing industry, and have nearly two decades of experience in web development and digital publishing. I'm a strong communicator who enjoys teaching, and I'm frequently the liaison between business, development, and design teams.

work.summary: Planned and iteratively developed business goals, success metrics, and implementation plans for large-scale web publishing platforms. Consulted for entertainment and news media clients on multi-channel publishing, editorial workflow and user experience, and structured content modeling.
highlights: Led content modeling and editorial workflow efforts for MSNBC.com replatforming
Evaluated and planned improvements to CNBC.com's decoupled publishing platform
Planned and oversaw execution of Apple's intranet content personalization system
Planned and helped execute Hotwire.com's structured content initiative
Extensive speaking and writing on structured content for multi-channel publishing

work.summary: Planned and implemented custom Drupal-based publishing platforms for clients including Harvard, WWE, Fast Company Magazine, Sony/BMG Music, and more. Advised development teams for clients including Stanford, Tesla Motors, and Verizon.
highlights: Designed and helped implement Sony/BMG Music's artist hosting platform, turning fan communities into a revenue-generating engagement tool.
Planned and led WWE.com replatforming, improving editor efficiency and site performance
Led the reorganization of Lullabot’s Drupal training curriculum
Developed Lullabot.com content strategy, served as site editor for three years

work.summary: Gathered customer requirements for and implemented Enterprise supply-chain automation software for grocery and retail sales customers.
highlights: Led testing and troubleshooting of legacy business processes
Optimized nightly data import workflow, cutting processing time by 75%
Designed and deployed a reusable framework for recurring data warehousing tasks

work.summary: Developed, tested, and deployed Dow Agroscience’s international chemical deployment tracking software; built custom sites and support software for web startups.
Planned and implemented the migration of a PERL/ColdFusion eCommerce site to ASP, gathered requirements from company stakeholders, and supported site end-users.
Implemented web marketing campaigns for small businesses, designed static HTML/CSS sites, and wrote copy for client sites and newsletters. Developed database-driven sites for ecommerce customers.

volunteer.summary: Planned and managed content and IA improvements for Drupal.org
Architecture, development, and community management for the Drupal open source CMS
highlights: Co-developed Drupal 6's improved form display and processing API
Developed and maintained VotingAPI, Drupal's user feedback system
Developed and maintained of TokenAPI, Drupal's dynamic content system
Frequent speaker, writer, and teacher on Drupal development and architecture

publications.name: Using Drupal, 1st Edition
publications.summary: Planned and co-authored the first guide to solutions-oriented Drupal site architecture.

publications.name: The Battle For The Body Field
publications.summary: Describes the challenges of structured content modeling for media-rich narrative content, and outlines promising solutions from the XML world.

publications.name: Dodging Cassandra
publications.summary: What opera can teach us about managing high-risk projects.

publications.name: When Editors Design
publications.summary: Summarizes lessons on editorial design control for structured content from major news and intranet projects.

publications.name: Inline Editing and the Cost of Leaky Abstractions
publications.summary: A detailed analysis of the pros and cons of Medium-style 'in-place WYSIWYG editing.'

publications.name: Growing Up Goddy
publications.summary: Essays on Evangelical culture by a Christian expat.

references.name: Karen McGrane
references.reference: Eaton is, quite seriously, one of the smartest people working in the content management space today. People who are good strategic, conceptual thinkers and also have deep technical prowess are not that common, and Eaton is one of the best.

references.name: James Walker
references.reference: I had the pleasure of working directly with Jeff for a few years on large Drupal/CMS architecture projects. His ability to see the big picture and make sense of complicated problems is as good as I've ever encountered. His technical understanding is only surpassed by his ability to effectively communicate his ideas.

references.name: Emma Jane Westby
references.reference: Jeff has an amazing capacity to tease apart difficult problems. He listens carefully and has a knack for knowing when to poke holes and when to provide affirmation. He also has the confidence to ask others for their opinion, incorporating their feedback and stories into his own work while still maintaining the integrity of his voice when communicating his findings.
